We appreciate your nice comment regarding the food.  However, We’re sorry about the noise during your stay. We will look into this point. I understand the discomfort this caused you. Again, I do apologize and regret that this impacted your experience at our hotel. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

title: Quiet hotel close to the beach
review: My Family and I have stayed at this hotel many times. I also have an apartment next door. I am very disappointed that the hotel bar is closed randomly and that the only beverage available for some hours is from the vending machine!  On the basis that some days it is possible to sit by the pool with a glass or of beer or wine and then other days, nothing is available is totally beyond belief. The fact that the under utilised receptionist is unwilling or unqualified to get up and pour a drink for customers is ridiculous. Tried to get details of the manager so I could express my concerns but apparently he is only at the hotel twice a week!  Given that Spain has such economic difficulties how bad is this.  I ate at the hotel last week to find that the waiter said he had not been…

title: Alicante Holiday with friends
review: Dear caroleek,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay.  It is unfortunate the bar schedule prevented you from fully enjoying your time at the hotel.  We are confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.   Thank you again for your comments, we look forward to serving you in the future.   Sincerely,  Ben J Case Manager IHGCare

title: Average hotel...good for the beach
review: It is a very quiet hotel close to one of the best beaches. Staff is excellent especially Eva and Marina at the reception. The breakfast served is a good spread, however the other menus are quite limited. The swimming pool was closed on first 2 days of our stay due to maintenance but it was really great for next 2 days. The beds in the room have wheels which can be quite annoying in the night. If you are looking for night-life then it is better to stay in Alicante city as there is not much to do in the evening around this hotel. Overall very good experience.

title: Pleasently Surprised!
review: I booked this as a secret Hotel option because it was advertised as close to Alicante centre, I guess there are many interpretations of close, mine was that it was not as close as I had hoped. However, after reading dissapointing reveiws I had no way of changing my booking so bit the bullet and off we went. I have to say that the Hotel was very nice, clean, pleasent staff and yes only a few spoke fluent English but for me even though I speak no Spanish it was not a problem. The pool and pool furniture was clean and in very good order, towels are available from reception to use at the pool only, not the beach, they get you to sign for a blue ticket and you exchange it for a towel when you want one and they pass it back when you return the wet towel. Breakfast was great, even on…

title: Avoid This Hotel!!!
review: Stayed for 3 days,I am PC Platinum member, they didn't recognise my status, then didn't get any room upgrade. reception couldn't speak any other languages apart Spanish, then wrote down on the paper my Amex charge card details, when I ask what for, get quick answer that it's them procedures in Spain, and I am not in UK!... but overall at the check in time Receptionist (lady ) was one of the best staff in this hotel, probably she would like to help me, but Hotel is understaffed as there just 1 person on duty and no one else! Hoverer hotel is very old, later I found out that it's around 15 years, rooms is not nice enough for 4 star hotel or even for Holiday Inn. I get really upset on second day on my stay, when I been injured in hotel swimming pool, I've cut myself, then I went to…

title: Fine for a cheap base for last minute sunshine
review: Dear Grigorijus,  Thank you for being a Priority Club Platinum Member and taking the time to write us a review. It is good to know that you found our location suitable for your needs. I am sorry that you found your stay less than satisfactory due to the service you received from our staff. Your comments have been taken noted and these will be used to improve our efforts.  Once again, many thanks for your feedback.  Sincerely,  Pam G. Case Manager IHGCare

title: Good hotel
review: We booked the Holiday Inn as a top secret hotel on Lastminute.com when looking for a cheap break away for somewhere sunny in late October. For the price, we can't complain at all, and we got the sunshine we were looking for (around 18-20 degrees compared to 6 in London!).  The good things: Breakfast was plentiful and ran until 10.30am. Standard buffet food, but lots of it The pool area: big and clean, and almost empty when we were there. Too cold to swim but perfect for catching the sun The restaurant: we ate in one night and were extremely pleased with the quality of food and the portion sizes given the price The location: a 10 minute (max) stroll to the beach, where there are plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants (even in the off season, most were open), and a 20 minute bus to…

title: Loved it
review: Hotel location is really great. It is withing 10 minutes from the beach and about 10-15 minutes from the main cafes and restaurants. The room we were gicen was in a new part of the hotel, on a high floor. It was comfortable, quite and clean. The only drawback was that the bed had rolling wheels and we were waking up with a gap between our beds.  Each room has safe, where we were leaving our documents and jewellery. The hotel has got free wifi and the signal was quite strong in our rooms, so it was a great plus. The pool was good and the area around it was organised well. There are some tables around the pool, where we had our birthday breakfast.

title: Good hotel, easy to get anywhere from
review: This hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the beach which later on in the season was quiet with plenty of restaurants to get a Drink at.   Has a good, if a bit shallow, pool which catches the sun for the vast majority of the day. Free wi-fi was a definite plus for this place too.  Would stay here again.

title: Pleasant, Pain!!
review: We first arrived to the hotel and we were greeted by welcoming staff, extremely polite and efficient. But we ended up getting a twin room, not ideal for a couple whatsoever! especially after requesting a double. We enjoyed the swimming pool ( except the sunbed that collapsed ever other minute which drove me insane) other then that very clean. Woman at the pool bar was very nice! Right beside the beach which was great.  THEN, to my dismay,on the third day arrived at the hotel room to find that the door could be just opened from the outside without a key...thankfully nothing was missing! I then went to reception where I was told we could stay in the room for the night until it was fixed in the morning ( i thought she was joking as it was only 6 in the afternoon) but she was not!!…

title: 2 night stopover
review: We stayed here for the last two nights of our holiday prior to our flight home from alicante airport. We had a hire car so this fitted in well as the hotel had large free car park and was only 35 mins drive to the airport.Rooms were large clean and spacious the only downside was there was a slight smell of smoke in the room.  Well located 10 mins walk from the lovely beach area,15 mins drive into Alicante which is well worth a visit.  Nice pool. Breakfast fine. Evening meal fine. Free wi fi all in all  good value for money.

title: Affordable and close to the beach.
review: Not really my style but picked up a room for a few nights on lastminute.com as a "secret deal". Very friendly reception made for pleasant check in but room was as expected....Holiday Inn.  Rated the location as a 3 but depends on your needs. If you want beach, tourists it's a 10min walk away. Town with good restaurants are 20min by tram.  Got a great rate and would recommend for a family looking for affordable getaway option.

title: Nice small hotel
review: Had 2 days at this hotel which was well served by bus and tram. All up to the usuall Holiday Inn standard with only one complaint. You could not close the curtains! The rails on each side of the window only ran half way across the opening. A design flaw that should have been seen to when the hotel was new. Very clean and unusall to find such a well maintaiuned outside swimming pool

title: Inexpensive hotel close to beautiful San Juan beach
review: This hotel is in a quiet neighbourhood of Alicante just 5 min walk away from San Juan beach. The hotel seems to be from the eigthies but has been partially refurbished. We had one of the newer rooms in the "tower" which was quite nice and spacious. We had breakfast in the restaurant (12 € per person) which was quite ok but every day the same. The atmosphere was not overwhelming. There is a litte pool with sun loungers. Towels are available but no cushions. There is also a small gym but half of the machines are broken. The staff is in general friendly and helpful. A tramway stop is not far away and you will be downtown in 20 minutes at very low cost. Free WiFi is available with good performance but does not work everywhere in the hotel.  Bottom line: The best features of this…

title: Lovely stay for 4 days!
review: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my then Fiances 30th birthday (he is now my hubby so I guess I did good ).  We had a lovely time. Clean well kept rooms, lunch menu in the bar was decent. Drinks on tap. The pool was lovely and was never too crowded even though locals pipped in to use it! Would definitely return.

title: Great Airport stopover
review: We stayed for one night before flying home after our holiday in Moraira. The Hotel is a typical Holiday Inn, very helpful and friendly staff on reception, comfortable Air Conditioned rooms, a nice pool area and a reasonably priced bar. There is plenty of car parking available.  The hotel is located approx 10mins stroll from San Juan's long sandy beach. Alicante old town is worth a visit with plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from. A single journey is appox 10 to 12 Euros in a cab.     All in all a great place to stay on the last day of our holiday and as only 30mins from the Airport, it was ideal for an early morning flight home.

title: Basic but clean and good location
review: This hotel is situated next door to our apartment and we use it regularly for family overflow and as our 'local'.   It is fairly basic and rooms and amenities in them are pretty sparse. We try to get a suite if we stay there and there are a few. The prices vary considerably and we have paid between 60 -120 euros depending on the time of visits  Other people say they get fantastic deals for as low as 30 euros a night  Restaurant is quite utilitarian and understaffed  Food not wonderful. Bar staff a bit ratty and unhelpful at times!

title: nice family hotel with a great beach nearby
review: We had two short stays in late August and September. Rooms 408 and 508 (both smoking which was the deal we got through Hotels.com). Nice hotel with friendly efficient staff (most of whom speak some English). Rooms were what you would expect from a Holiday Inn. The pool area was nice and the kids had a lot of fun in there. The beach is a short walk and is magnificent- very busy in August but by the time we left on 4th September things had really quietened down. We had super hot weather but the AC in the room made it really comfortable at nights. Pool bar provided us with an easy dinner one night (pizza. sausages and chips etc.) and the bar prices were also reasonable. The hotel has a lot of Spanish families staying in August and the two lifeguards played great games with the kids…

title: dont ask dont get
review: we stayed  for   4 nights  on our  arrival we were greeted  with  a  lovely welcome , everything  went  smooth we asked  questions  which were answered . the rooms  are  very airy with excellent  air con and  all you would expect from  a  4 star  spanish hotel. we  had breakfast  included  which was  help yourself  all  nicely prepared  hot  and cold  food  even  the  toaster worked !!  the pool area was  clean and roomy , except  the sun beds were very ancient  kept  breaking and  no cushions and  the  jacuzzi didnt work, plenty of beds  available  at any time of day, the pool bar was  mostly manned  but  for some reson the server went missing  on many occasions. the fantastic beach is  a good  pleasant  15 min walkaway  with ample beds parosols 3.50 euro each bed. many…

title: Not that great!
review: We booked the Holiday Inn as we thought we could be pretty sure of getting a good standard.  Unfortuately not so.  The reception staff didn't give us any information when we arrived, it was only by accident that we found out that they provided towells for the pool, maps of the area etc.  The room had the loudest air conditioning I have ever heard.  We were there for 6 nights and complained about this after the first night.  A maintenance man was sent up that day.  However he couldn't solve the problem and when we returned to the room that evening we couldn't get in.  We were then told by reception that they had changed out room.  However we had booked a room with three single beds as we were 3 single people, the room they had moved us to had a double bed and a double sofa bed so…

title: Holiday out!
review: Noisy leaking air con. No Wi Fi in room. Poorly informed staff on front desk. Safe also not working. A very very basic hotel. Nice guys at the pool who were v good at keeping the children amused with very little resources. Thank goodness we were just there for a couple of nights.

title: Very comfortable stay, lovely breakfast too!
review: Dear 5starforme,  Thank you for taking time out of your busy day to leave us a candid review. I appreciate the compliments on our hotel staff at the pool. We are very proud of our hotel and our high standards of service, cleanliness and quality. I am sorry to hear that we fell below your expectations on this occasion. My sincere apologies for any inconveniences and discomfort you experienced due to the condition of the air conditioning unit, internet services and  hotel front desk services. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future.  We appreciate your feedback as this is our best resource for improving guest services. We do hope you decide to give us another chance for a future stay.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHGCare

title: Excellent value for the money and great location close to beach and public transit
review: We only spent one night here but it was just great. Comfortable beds, quiet room and plenty of choice for breakfast, even for the British clientele there was plenty of bacon, sausage & fresh eggs. There was also plenty of fresh fruit, cold meats, cheeses & even a special area for children to help themselves! The air con was a bit too cold in the room, but that was soon remedied when we asked at reception for the air con remote controls which allow you to adjust the temperature to your liking. We didn't get chance to use the pool, but it looked inviting and there were plenty of sun beds free. We would definitely stay here again. One other thing, if you want a non smoking room, make sure you mention this on booking as the room we stayed in had a clearly been used by smokers, it…

title: Lovely little hotel, great staff
review: Had a girly trip out to alicante, rooms were clean and tidy. Staff really friendly and very helpful. Short walk to the beach and restaurants. Sunloungers not comfy at all as old and bowed, umbrellas round the pool were broken but hotel itself was clean, good breakfast buffet selection.

title: Excellent stay
review: Spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn on a last minute break. Hotel is well located - 10 minute walk to the beach and restaurants etc.  It is in a quiet residential area and it is extremely relaxed.  The pool area is spotlessly clean and the pool bar was open whilst we were there (I think it is only open in the main season).  Never any problem getting a sun bed - and there was a mix of families and couples.   Guests seemed to be mainly Spanish with a few English.  All the staff at the hotel were excellent and spoke good English.  They were extremely helpful and friendly.   Breakfast was typical european fair - at 12 euros per person, unless you are on a B&B rate is is probably not worth the money.  We ate in the restaurant one evening only and to be honest I would not recommend it -…

title: Not bad for the price...
review: I had been in Holiday Inn for many times not here. I found this place something amazing. The staffs are friendly, the hotel was clean. I found this place cleaner than other holiday inn franchise.  Definitely, worth for your money.

title: Near the beach, nice people...
review: As some of the other opinions remark, the location of this hotel is maybe the most convenient in the area to visit the beach (after the hotel Sidi San Juan closed). The staff is nice and they use to promote (free) the breakfast during the weekends.

title: Clean and functional
review: Convenient location - 15 minutes walk to very nice beach area, 5 minutes walk to the tram stop etc Clean - rooms and the public areas of the hotel were very acceptable in terms of cleanliness Polite - All staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful Bearing in mind two nights here cost us only £70, I'd be delighted to recommend.

title: Nice hotel handy for the beach.
review: Stayed for a long weekend.  Hotel is 5 mins walk from the beach and is about 20 mins from the centre of Alicante by tram.  We had a good clean room on the second floor.  None of the rooms have a view of the sea, the area is very built up.  Nice pool but the sun loungers really need replaced before someone hurts themselves.

title: Holiday Inn San Juan. Alicante
review: Just had 2 nights at this hotel. Really nice hotel easy access to Alicante on the tram. Very close to the sea and centre. The staff at the hotel .where very helpfull. Rooms good size and clean. Would stay again.

title: Good hotel near the beach
review: Hotel is convenient in terms of facilities, is well mantained, clean, room sizes are alright, quality of sleep adequate and alright service. An average 3-4 stars near the beach but not so for a beach hotel (10-15 mins walk). Spa is not such, just a room with a self-service sauna.

title: Good place for holidays
review: Hotel located very close to the sea - walking 5 min. Hotel have a lot of parking space. My room was clean and big. Hotel also have a outdoor sweeming pool and nice sitting area around , you also can order a drink and food. Staff is very friendly and speak good english.

title: I don't mean to be an American snob, but---
review: We had difficulty finding the hotel, and when we called the hotel, the sweet but not-very-fluent-in-English front desk clerk had great difficulty telling us how to get to the hotel.  Actually a clerk at another hotel drew on our map;  we were just a few minutes away. BUT, the room was fine for one night, and the restaurant was better than expected.  The dedicated parking lot was much appreciated.

title: peace and calm
review: Nice hotel, stayed a weekend with children, there was entertainment for them, big and clean room employees very nice, shame about the weather, sunny but windy. We will return of course

title: If you are sexually active give this one a miss
review: Thank god I god upgraded with my priority club membership otherwise I may have been in the toilet, The upgraded room had twin beds on wheels upon a wooden floor meant when we woke my girlfriend was on the floor and my bed was by the window. On the occasion we ate in the restaurant my side plate had a piece of bread which seemed hard enough to beat someone within an inch of their lives with. The waitress was serving others hot bread from a basket and when I dared ask her for fresh bread she proceeded to my girlfriends amazement to rip the bread to shreds right in my face and all over the table screaming it fresh, it fresh. Hunger forced us onward to order what was advertised as the best paella in Spain only to receive a bowl of rice and mushroom soup with a thumbnail of meat. The…

title: Quite good hotel
review: Dear AlanBarber,  Thank you for staying with us and leaving a review.  We are pleased to hear you are a Priority Club member and glad the hotel was able to upgrade your room.  I was disappointed to read that when you visited the restaurant you did not find it to your tastes, we will review for possible modifications so to better accommodate our guest in the future.    If there is anything you need next time you stay with us, please do not hesitate to let us know.  Sincerely, Jaime W Case Manager IHGCare

title: Good way to beach.
review: We (one couple) stayed there with two children (about two years) in one room (bonus point stay). They gave us a big room with two double beds. But it turned out that we needed an additional baby bed to separate the kids. This was charged additionally which was not so nice but at the end usual for hotels. The room (with four people) was ok (four star compatible) but it was always cleaned (four people produce a lot of carbage). Very nice was the WLAN availability in the room. The beds were a little strange (felt like a water-bed, sometimes), The restaurant was most of the time ok. Price -quality relation good. But one day (plate of the day) it was horrible. I can recommend the paellas and the fish. But You should not take the meat. The breakfast was quite good and ond emand they…

title: Good value although perhaps a little too far away from the bustle of Alicante.
review: The breadth and room cleaning. Convenience and easy access to the beach. Staff pleasant and helpful. Parking facilities. Very good value for money. I liked the situation on the beach. Isolated and close simultaneously. I love how you rest at night. Tranquility. The tub did not work and the card room would crash constantly to use the facilities. That was in a basement room with horrible views.

title: Good if you just wanna sleep
review: Cheap hotel, good if you're just looking for a comfortable place where to sleep, 10minutes away from the beach, better than the small pool who's always too busy... You better rent a car/or scooter if you choose this hotel, caused you'll be pretty far from town and the night-life of alicante!!!! So an easy-going hotel to recommand more for young travelers without much money than for families...

title: Sucky food served by hotel restaurant
review: Overall the stay was nice except for the dining experience i had during my stay at here... The fish that i had wasnt fresh and it tasted fishy, service was good only the food was disappointing

title: Comfortable and friendly hotel, 10 minutes stroll from the beach.
review: Stayed for seven nights whilst on holiday in the area. Room was of a good size, comfortable, clean and well maintained. Complimentary wi-fi worked well in the room and was a most welcome added benefit. The hotel is well situated in a safe area, amongst other residential apartments and houses. The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and informative. Breakfast at the hotel was good and to a standard one would expect from the Holiday Inn group generally. The beautiful San Juan beach is a leisurely 10 minute stroll from the hotel. The resort itself is fairly quiet and gives the impression of being a safe, relaxed area with several good standard restaurants and bars. I would have no hesitation in staying at the hotel again and would recommend it to friends etc.

title: Excellent customer service....really enjoyable stay - would definitely recommend!
review: First of all, as a group of 4 young guys, we found the hotel to be in a perfect location, literally just up the road from the san juan beach. Marta and the team were fantastic and catered for all our needs. Most definitely went the extra mile on each occasion. The decor and facilities of the hotel were up to a good standard.   A big thank you to the team from Amer, Omar, Fess and Abi

title: Good value and helpful staff
review: Stayed here two nights. The hotel is easily reached by number 21 bus from where the airport shuttle stops outside the Melia at Alicante harbour, the bus stops right outside the hotel. The same bus can be used to go to and from Alicante town at 20 min intervals. A taxi from Alicante was about 13 Euro.  It has a small but nice pool area and is only a 5 minute walk down the hill to the beach. Our room was comfortable and clean with the usual basics. The girls who do reception are exceptionally pleasant and helpful, as were the rest of the staff except the grumpy barman. We had a late flight and they had no hesitation in allowing us to use the gym showers to clean up and change after spending the spare time after checking out on the beach.

title: Good choice if you travel by car
review: Hotel with a lot of parking places, therefore we choosed this hotel for two night stay. It has nice pool in hotel garden hidden from the street. Beach and restaurants are in few minutes walking distance. We were lucky, because 23rd of June thousands of eople were celebrating fiesta San Juan on the beach, made fire in hundreds of places and had fun. Amazing view and positive memories!

title: brief stay ... does the job
review: The hotel is near the beach and is a great place for sun worshipers. Previous reviews have described it as difficult to find but we followed the clear directions and got to the property first time. Our rooms were of a decent size and everthing seemed clean. We only had two minor issues - the air conditioning is not the best in or most efficient in the world and the spa bubbles in the pool/jacuzzi did not work and according to a staff member have not worked for the whole season ! Some lovely little restaurants on the beach seafront which is only a short walk away.

title: Superb again!!
review: Had our yearly stay at the Holiday Inn Playa de San Juan. Fantastic staff.. a big hello to Domingo and his team. Rooms are large with fridge and air con with daily maid service. Food tasty and reasonably priced for bar meals.   Pool is large but never crowded, nor is it too dificult to get a free lounger,there is a pool bar selling drinks and hot snacks if needed. The centre of San Juan is a 10 min stroll away as is the fantastic beach.  This is a business hotel but has many many tourists visiting, there are English people but mainly Spanish in August.  Roll on next August 2012

title: Very good family hotel
review: We had a problem when we arrived in that we had booked two rooms with the request that they be non smoking and together. The rooms that we were shown to where not like the rooms advertised on the website, they were small and they were not together and one of them smelled really badly of cigarette smoke. I wanted to change to another hotel straight away, however the manager assured us that we would be moved the next day. They handled the situation really well and the next day we were moved. The rooms were a lot nicer and they were together. We stayed at the hotel for eight days, our kids are 11 and 14 and they had a great time. The animation team are very good especially Fernando Salamo and Noelia we hardly saw the boys. We had breakfast at the hotel every day, it was okay. We…

title: Not much to excite you
review: Possibly a 3 star, not 4. Check in was friendly and the staff spoke English.The rooms were big and quite nice. Clean but needs some tarting up. Some lack of preparation as our fridge had not been turned on and contents were warm. The air conditioning was good and there is a swimming pool in the complex. It is pleasantly located about 400 mtrs from  the beach.

title: Decent Hotel at a decent rate
review: Stayed here for only one night due to issues with the vacation rental we had. Efficient check in, good beds and very clean.  Rate was ok at a 100 Euro for 2 per night, breakfast was extra 12 Euro, but acceptable. Good selection of warm and cold foods, coffee, tea, juices. Breakfast by the pool under palm trees a big +.  Dinner was a bit more expensive, than outside but it saved us looking for a place. Food was good, service a bit "spanish", but acceptable.  Wifi signal in the room not good, but in all common areas and the garden very good, and free of charge.  Located not to far from the beach (Playa San Juan), but in a quiet area. Parking was ample, but not locked or guarded.  We would stay here again if we require a room in the Alicante area.

title: Excellent Holiday Inn - in a perfect Spanish location!
review: Perfect location, the hotel was very clean and well maintained. All staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful from arrival to departure one week later. I have stayed in quite a few hotels and this is definately one that I would return to. If you are looking for a family sun holiday you are only a few minutes from the beach which is absolutely spotless, there are several childrens playgrounds within 3 minutes walk and a very good supermarket again within 3 minutes from the hotel. The location has many local restaurants and bars, I would recommend you learn a few basic Spanish words as the majority of people here only speak Spanish. There are no drunken teenage Brits or 'English Pubs selling beans on toast' in this location which is great if your looking for a genuine…

title: Good hotel not far from the beach.
review: Stayed here for 3 nights in July.  Arrived by tram from the centre of Alicante which took about 20 mins and cost about €2.50 each.  The hotel is a block away from the nearest stop (Plaza de Naciones), but the tram goes in a loop around San Juan so there are a number of other stops nearby.  Check in was efficient and we were given a room on the 4th floor.  Most of the hotel is just 2 storey but there is a 5 storey block at one end.  Room had plenty of space and a large comfortable bed. Both the room and the bathroom were clean.  There was also a sofa bed with a slightly tatty cover.  There was also a mini bar.  None of the rooms have balconies and our view was out towards a very large apparment block. We ate breakfast in the hotel twice which was a self service buffet.  No…

title: Quite a long way from Alicante
review: Couldn't agree more with the previous review regarding directions - very confusing. There seem to have been recent changes to route and exit numbers in this area. The correct motorway is the A-70, and the correct exit number is 68. The hotel itself is a decent enough Holiday Inn. Niggles - only one elevator was working (= some longish waits), the bartender charged for an extra beer (wasn't worth arguing - deducted it from the tip), the location is a long way from Alicante (certainly not walking distance - there is a tram but couldn't work out ticketing) and nearby there are many half-finished, half-sold building developments which look awful & will be waiting a long time for buyers in the current economy. The beach didn't look especially clean or attractive (brown sand, like…

title: Don't follow the hotel's directions and you'll be fine
review: A perfectly good Holiday Inn. You know what you'll get: clean, airconditioned room, choice of pillows, excellent breakfast. But if you're driving yourself from Alicante airport my strong advice is not to follow the driving directions provided by the hotel. The directions on the hotel's website are different from those I received on the booking confirmation direct from Holiday Inn's reservation system - and both are misleading. I arrived at night, and this problem is compounded by the road system in San Juan: many one-way streets, with street signs almost impossible to see in the dark. I called the hotel's front desk for help, and their directions were vague and unhelpful. So if you've hired a car at the airport for your stay, pay a cab to lead you in convoy, and arrive without…

title: Excellent all round hotel
review: Just returned from a 3 night break at this hotel and have to say it was excellently located for every thing we wanted.  We just got a taxi transfer from Alicante airport which cost 37 euros, then once we were there we used the locln bus service which is cheap and the stops are right at the hotel so no need to walk anywhere.    The beach of San Juan is a 5 min walk and is fabulous, at this time of year it was very quiet and fabuolous, spotlessly clean and you could walk for miles.  All round excellently located hotel and will definately be returning soon.

title: o.k. stay in february
review: Well, Friendly personal service, clean rooms, nice breakfast, nice poolarea, ok  stay !  a few minus- every day you have to ask for new on internet, would be nicer if they could just give you a log inn for you're total stay. -the location feels a bit in a neighbourhood with lot of high rice buildings, with no charm. The beach is probably on walking distance, it was to cold in this time of year for us. The location had no wow factor, but i guess if you're going for the beach, in the summer this will be a ok choice. -the rooms hads lots of space ! that's a plus.

title: Clean break!
review: We went for long weekend on our Priority Points January 21st.   Great pool sun area protected enough to feel warm sun - just what we came for. Breakfast good value. Ate twice for evening meal and both times really good. We had room upgrade very clean and comfortable. Towels changed daily. Reception ladies very friendly and helpful. Only gripe was wi fi signal slow. Definitely go again.

title: Ideal for a weekend getaway, superb location
review: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend in middle of October.  The hotel was just as I expected.   The check in was efficient and friendly and our room was clean and very comfortable.  It is obviously a hotel that caters for conferences and business meetings but at the weekend it was very quiet which made it very relaxing.  We didn't eat in the restaurant but did have drinks and a bar meal.  The quality was good and I was pleasantly surprised at the cost which was more than reasonable.  The supermarket was literally just round the corner and the restaurants on the beach front were excellent and again good value for money.  I had no problems with connecting to the free Wi Fi with my i pod, but just had to get them to authorise my room on the system each day.  The pool area was…

title: I love this Hotel!!!
review: This hotel really is good find and is amazing value.  We stayed there in June loved it so much we immediately booked for October and have already booked again for next year.  It is situated 600 metres from one of the most fantastic beaches I have ever seen. The rates are really attractive and the breakfast at €12 represents pretty good value.  The staff are very friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are spacious and clean and the housekeeping is excellent.  It is approx €30 (with tip) for the the taxi from Alicante airport but it is possible to use public transport (airport bus & tram) providing you only had hand luggage.  The internet is free but they have to activate your room everyday which is a tiny bit frustrating.  Alicante - Playa San Juan is a really nice quiet resort…

title: Great little hotel, at a fantastic price
review: Stayed here for 6 days in June 2009 and have to say, the hotel far exceeded expectations,  from the outside, it looked excellent, just like the promo pics, had seen the other reviews about overlooking apartments, but i have to be honest, they were far enough away to not cause me any concern at all,  the room was very comfortable and spacious, the decor was a little dated, but not badly so, air con in the room was fantastic, good bathroom facilities and a safe also. the only niggle would be that the double bed was two beds put together, which had a tendency to migrate away from each other in the night, leading to the odd bout of being eaten by the bed. but a few well placed books against the wheels helped out there  Housekeeping changed our linen every day, cleaned the room well…

title: Perfect girlie weekend away...can't wait for Sept 2011!
review: This Hotel is perfect for a weekend stay.  The room was a good size and contained all the necessary items, including a safe and mini-bar.  There is a supermarket just a few minutes walk away so essential snack items can easily be acquired!! The Hotel seemed quiet and there were few children which was ideal for two Mum's who wanted to enjoy the last of the summer and get some R&R time!! The beach is about a 7/8min walk down a slight hill, from the hotel and it is beautifully clean and sandy.  The promenade has a variety of bars and restaurants that were reasonably priced. Will definately come back to tis area and will probably use this hotel again if can get great rates as we found on lastminute.com.

title: excellent hotel cant wait to go back
review: Stayed here for 5 days after our flight was cancelled due to the french air traffic control strike. We arrived at 2.30 in the morning and the staff were friendly and efficient getting us all into our rooms. we were  given a suite so grandaughter had her own room and tv.Room was comfortable clean and well stocked with toiletries and mini bar ( not too expensive) We cannot praise the staff enough especially the bar and waiting staff for how they looked after us considering they were unprepared for a coachload of disgruntled holidaymakers who wanted to go home. Swimming pool was excellent although jacuzzi part wasnt working,probably need a few more sun beds. breakfast buffet was excellent, good choices and nice quality food. excellent location, 3 blocks from a beautiful beach and…

title: Not sure if this is 4 star
review: Stayed for a couple of days on  business trip. Staff are very friendly and helpful, but some struggle with English. I could not get the wifi connection to work (as reported in an earlier review.) decor is probably ready for a face lift. Food is average but reasonably priced. in terms of value for money, pretty good and I would return

title: What a lovely Hotel and atmosphere.
review: Just arrived home from a 10 day holiday in this lovely hotel. It was everything we expected and more. Very friendly, clean and the staff in reception were brilliant. We arrived on a late flight and were given a twin room, the next day we mentioned this at reception and were transfered to a large double room. No view but not particularly worried about that as we only sleep there. The walk to the beach is direct about 10 mins stroll down a sloping road. Here you can hire beds and umbrellas if you wish. The sea was lovely and warm and the families all played along the front. Quite wavey at times though. Restaurants and shop all along the front and we walked to El Campello one day. We also visted Altea via the tram which is beyond Benidorm and returned to a fantastic restaurant…

title: Lovely hotel - exceeded our expectations
review: Arrived quite late - and we were welcomed by name...  our 3 rooms were close together on the third floor.. The rooms were modern and  spacious, well appointed and with efficient but quiet air conditioning.  During the week the hotel was very quiet, but got busier during the weekend.  Free towels for the pool were a great extra - and there were always plenty of beds and umbrellas.  We were often the only family at the pool.  Breakfast was excellent value for money - good selection and regularly refreshed.  Bar service was really good and prices were reasonable.  Domingo and David were great hosts.......and ample outside seating areas.  There was a good selection on the Restuarant (Kids eat free) and Bar Meals menu.and the quality and prices were good.  The resort is mainly…

title: Good location, but 4* hotel???
review: I've stayed at this hotel many times before and I always enjoyed its location and price/quality ratio. However, every time I go it seems to me that the hotel is starting to get old and tired. When I went there about 4 years ago I got the impression that it was a great hotel for a great price but since then I'm a little more disappointed every time. The hotel is still good, but they would really need to change their bed covers that look like they're borrowed from some old motel. The pool is nice, the staff very nice. They claim to give you free wifi internet connection but it only seems to work in the hotel lobby, almost ever time I stay there the connection is very bad in the room and this time it was simply inexistant, at the reception they wanted to help but didn't know how. I…

title: Nice hotel, wonderful staff
review: Got put up at this hotel for eight days during Iceland eruption.   The hotel is clean and staffed by the most welcoming people being put under extreme stress by the sudden influx of stranded passengers.   The staff coped very well and were very helpful when it came to providing information about the area.   My grandsons loved the pool and their parents loved the proximity to the restaurant and bar.   Agree about location being in middle of concrete jungle but beach was close and very nice.

title: hotel and staff lovely
review: we went for a short break and stayeds at the above hotel the hotel was lovely clean and spacious with really nice rooms, all the staff where very helpful however we found the food not satisfactory at all as stated the hotel is about a 15 min walk from the beach however it does not state that it is down a very steep hill making it and the resort very unwheelchair friendly which we where disappointed about because we had been told that it was

title: Good hotel in concrete jungle
review: The hotel has the qualities you expect and we didn't face any problem. The parking was free (which is a big thing in Spanish cities), the wifi was free, but had some minor problems. Generally, the hotel has "summer resort feeling". We stayed in March, out of season, and we were busy with our program, so the hotel worked great for us, but i wouldn't really recommend it for summer holiday (at least I wouldn't enjoy it there). It is in the middle of "concrete jungle" of tall apartment buildings and it is quite a walk to the beach (must be worse in summer heat). So, overall, good quality hotel in not so good place.

title: Great location, food, and hotel
review: We spent a week here using Priority Club Points which made the stay free but I did look at the prices and if booked in advance some great rates can be found.  The hotel is one of only a couple in Playa De San Juan and when we went in Oct was almost empty dispite the hote weather. Most guests using the hotel were business people and golfers so the pool area was often only used by us.  The hotel has good clean rooms with free wifi which is a real bonus the only down side in the rooms was lack of woking english TV stations. The resturant is great value and the evening meals and daytime snacks are good, the room service in contrast is vile and should be avoided. A business centre with PC and printer is handy for printing boarding cards. The pool is not heated and towels can be…

title: Good value for money, great for group of lads
review: Stayed here for a stag weekend in Alicante in Sept 09, a very decent hotel with a nice pool and good staff. Sergio at the main desk was particularly helpful in letting us know about the places to go and bus routes etc.  The hotel has a very nice restaurant, but is in a very quiet part of town. It's about 15 min walk to a very clean San Juan beach with nice beach side restaurant and close to a supermarket 5 mins away.  It is however, far out from from the centre of Alicante and bars/clubs, so if you're going for that reason it is probably best to go more central. The taxi is about 15 Euros to the centre although the bus stop right outside is only 1 Euro but takes about 25 mins.

title: A very relaxing quiet place - fantastic beaches
review: Stayed for just shy of a week and overall had a very relaxing time.  The hotel is comfortable but not spectacular - this in fairness is reflected in the price.  It is advertised on most sources as 4 star - I would challenge that this is good 3 star tops. Truth is it has barely any competition in the direct area.  Our room was spacious enough - very clean - a little tired style wise (but that doesn't worry me much) with all the basics you need - safe, minibar etc.  No tea or coffee facilities in the room which is frustrating and something Holiday Inn need to sort out as a brand - either it is a standard across the estate or not.  Experience has led us to take travel kettle and adaptor now whenever we travel.  I can absorb most cultural differences but I do need a decent cuppa in…

title: Very good as usual!
review: This is our third time staying here, staff are friendly with some like Karina, Domingo Sergio and David  speaking enough English to communicate without to much trouble. We like this hotel for a holiday as it is most relaxing. There is a lovely pool area at the hotel, but if you want the beach, which is spectacular it is just under 10 mins stroll from the hotel . Rooms are clean air conditioned, and modern as the whole of the hotel. Food is restaurant based or room service. we enjoyed whatever we had so I can only go on that. All in all we think that this is a very good hotel, and we will be going back next year.

title: Very nice and comfortable hotel
review: This hotel is very nice and comfortable. Rooms are very clean, not small. Bathroom was big enough. Breakfast was very good, with lot of food, no matter what time you come to eat. Swimming pool is small.   The area of the hotel is ugly and dirty, with lot of beton block of flats but is very quiet at night. We were very satisfied with this hotel and we would come back if we decide to go to Alicante again.  Beach is about 10 minutes walk from hotel along the block of flats. The beach was clean with many people around. The sea is clean and is very good to swim.

title: decent hotel
review: The hotel is in San Juan away from alicante city but the area and location of the hotel is very nice. Its about 7 mins walk from the beach where most activities take place.  The beaches are very clean and very touristy. The people living in the are are posh.  The hotel is clean and immaculate with a lovely swimming pool and a nice restaurant around it but the food is average and not for vegetarians.  The rooms are spacious, clean with big bathrooms and service is excellant. Language is a problem like most places in spain so learn a few words to understand and communicate with them. overall decent nice place to stay.

title: Brilliant value and super clean. Near to a beach
review: Stayed in the Holiday in for a hen weekend. We were on the top floor and the hotel was quiet - i think we were the only ones on this floor despite it being the UK bank hol. I can barely fault this hotel. It's not 5 star luxury but it is brilliant value and so so clean. The hotel looks very new and i could see no signs of wear. The only down sides were that there was no balcony (you don't need this is you are only there for a few days), no kettles in the rooms although there is a mini bar, and the food in the hotel for dinner was not too great but it's faitly cheap to eat out.   I would recommend this hotel if you wanted to go away for a long weekend to the beach for some sun. The beach is about 5 mins walk and has a long promenade with lots of bars and places to eat. I think…

title: Hotel is fine, area is grotty
review: Stayed here for a couple fo nights in Oct 08. The hotel is fine - clean, comfortable, nice food and a bar that's open most of the day for snacks etc - pretty much what I expected for a Holiday Inn.  However, it is completely surrounded and overlooked by ugly high rise apartment blocks which are an absolute nightmare to look at.   We went in search of a local cafe and supermarket, and there's nothing nearby. The nearest one we found was about half way along the beach.  There is grafitti everywhere, even on most of the buildings we passed on the way to Alicante town (which is very nice and has good shops)   Shan't bother with this area again - there must be prettier places on the Costa Blanca.

title: Average, ok for price
review: paid 90 euros including breakfast a night, and was happy with that price.  If i had paid any more I wouldnt have been.  its just a very bland business type hotel, in average condition.  room overlooked pool no  balcony or anything.  bathroom was good.   breakfast was pretty good. pool was okay was clean, but loungers were a bit old, pool fairly small and one depth all round,  good for younger kids. a fair walk from the beach, okay going down but coming back up the hill in 35 degree heat not great.  old town alicante is nice, the rest not great.  its a 10/15 minute drive away.  playa de san juan - the beach is great, loved it.  and some great restaurants along the beach. but you couldnt spend a week here i dont think.

title: ok but need to improve
review: Booked and paid 1 month in advance, when I reached the hotel the room was not ready, had to waste time in the restaurant a 4hrs wait, not the usual Holiday Inn service, the front staff were very defensive and were making all sorts of excuses. Rooms pretty basic no coffee or tea making facility in the room. A good decent breakfast, the pool was okay. Restaurant prices are reasonable and the waiting staff were very good with their service. Short walk to San Juan beach from the Hotel, which is very good. The Beach that is the main attraction in this area, which is really good. two supermarkets close by, and if you want to travel to Alicante bus No21 stops near the Hotel cost 1.1 Euro, don’t take the taxi the bus service is very good in this area. If you don’t speak Spanish Taxis…

title: Nice Hotel
review: Stayed here for 4 nights whilst on a golfing trip with three pals.  Perfectly adequate hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff, good bar and a very decent breakfast. A little out of town but only 10 euros in by taxi.  Highly recommended

title: Vacation hotel, room service issues- Not for Business
review: Hi,  stayed here 12-17 August.  Booked it because it has wi-fi, so I could stay in touch with my business while away... Wi-fi connection is poor, had about 30 minutes connection over the 6 days there. I would not go there again if I wish to connect to the internet.  Stayed there with my wife & 5 year old son, in a family room. Swimming pool is great, my son loved it. It has a small pool for kids. a jacuzzi - whirlpool, in which anyone can go, so my son loved that  too, and a larger pool. The hotel supplied lounger chairs, towels, and for the younger guests, a free beachball and 'penguins' carry bag.  The rooms are spacious,  with CNN,  a few sport TV channels,  the sofa bed springs can hurt after a few days.  First night we ordered room-service food, french fries and hot meat -…

title: Nice hotel, ideal for short break
review: My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights in July 07. The other reviews are not wrong when they say the hotel is difficult to find, once passed the hospital follow the signs to San Juan beach then when you see Macdonalds on your left the hotel is more or less at the end of the road on your right. The hotel was very clean and the staff where friendly and helpful. The room was fairly small but fine for 2 nights and we over looked the pool. We paid for the buffet breakfast and I thought it was well worth the 11 euro's. There is some construction work taking place on a building next door to the hotel but we didn't really notice the noise. We caught the number 21 bus from outside the hotel to Campello, it takes around 20 minutes and is full of Spanish Bars and restautrants (and the…

title: Great short break
review: We visited Alicante the last w/e in May 2007.  I booked the Holiday Inn due to it's established name and brand and it did not disappoint.  Friendly accomodating staff, good food and good clean air conditioned rooms.  Location could be better but not a reason not to go back.  The area was VERY quiet but largely due to it being pre-season.  Outside of the hotel and in Alicante in general you can expect the language barrier to be an issue - much to our surprise.  It helps to have some Spanish phrases.  Tips: Walk out main gate of hotel and turn left.  Stay straight & 10 mins later you're on the beach.  Beach was perfect, as good as it gets.  The marina is a ten minute taxi ride (anywhere between €10 - €13) which is where you need to be for the good restaturaunts. The no. 21 bus is…

title: Good Value
review: Recently returned from a 6 night say at The Holiday Inn Playa de San Juan. Before booking I checked previous reviews which seemed to indicate this would be a good choice. Thanks to openness of Trip Advisor, it proved to be spot on.  Arrival was early evening and the desk staff had everything to hand to ensure a swift check in except that they checked us in to a no smoking room. When they checked on the computer to see if they could switch us they were unable to do so. This proved to be no problem though, as they produced an ashtray and said it would be fine to use the given room as a smoking room !!!!.  Room size was above average and very clean as indeed was the bathroom complete with over bath shower. An efficient air conditioning controller provided the opportunity to have…

title: Playa de san Jaun is a must!
review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn at Playa de san Juan in September. This is a nice hotel, with a good, though smallish pool which is usually quiet, good for getting sunbeds. Hotel provides towels for pool area. Avoid the pool lunchtime menu though, over priced and undercooked food. Located in a residential area with lots of surrounding concrete, so a car is recommended. Cool and clean rooms and staff were pleasent enough without being overbearing. Make sure you have good walking legs, as there is plenty of walking to get to nearby amenities.  Hotel is a good 10 minute walk to one of the best beaches I've been to. The beach is long, sandy, clean and scattered with nice fish restaurants. Close by are lots of bars, other restaurants and shops. The Frontera bar is excellent, real…

title: Super Hotel
review: We stayed here for a week in July 2006 and found it excellent.  It is a fairly modern hotel in good condition ,clean and well maintained. The rooms are large, well equipped and comfortable.  There are always at least 2 staff on reception and they are very friendly and helpful. The fairly large pool and surrounding areas are well designed and very clean.  The restaurant is actually surprisingly good and  good value for an evening meal if you don't feel like going out. Breakfasts are excellent - usually included in the price  -with a reasonable selection of cereals, yogurts, cold meats and cheeses, breads, pastries etc as well as bacon, sausage egg etc - and a good selection of freshly prepared fruit -  as much as  you can eat. It is an easy 10 minute walk to Playa San Juan - the…

title: Very good value
review: We just spent a week there over Easter 2005. The standard is good as you would expect from a Holiday Inn. The staff are well-trained and helpful.  It's about a 10-minute walk down to the San Juan beach, although the southern end is currently a building site as the promenade (paseo maritimo) is being rebuilt. Further on, you can walk several miles north along the prom as far as El Campello.  The swimming pool at the hotel is well laid out and usually quiet. I advise asking for a room on the first floor facing the pool.  Outside the hotel is a bus stop for the Number 21 bus which run frequently into Alicante at a standard cost of 90 cent.
